title: The Great Gatsby
description: A story of decadence and excess, Gatsby explores the darker aspects of the Jazz Age.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: The Great Gatsby is a 1925 novel by American writer F. Scott Fitzgerald. Set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, the novel depicts narrator Nick Carraway's interactions with mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and Gatsby's obsession to reunite with his former lover, Daisy Buchanan.

title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
description: A must-read for every programmer who wants to write better, more maintainable code.
author: Robert C. Martin
summary: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn't have to be that way.

title: Dune
description: A masterpiece of science fiction that tells the story of young Paul Atreides.
author: Frank Herbert
summary: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the 'spice' melange, a drug capable of extending life and enhancing consciousness.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: A groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution.
author: Yuval Noah Harari
summary: From a renowned historian comes a groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution that explores the ways in which biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be 'human'.

title: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel and children's book by English author J. R. R. Tolkien.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins is a hobbit who enjoys a comfortable, unambitious life, rarely traveling any farther than his pantry or cellar. But his contentment is disturbed when the wizard Gandalf and a company of dwarves arrive on his doorstep.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: A mystery thriller novel by Dan Brown.
author: Dan Brown
summary: While in Paris on business, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon receives an urgent late-night phone call: the elderly curator of the Louvre has been murdered inside the museum.

title: The Shining
description: A horror novel by American author Stephen King.
author: Stephen King
summary: Jack Torrance's new job at the Overlook Hotel is the perfect chance for a fresh start. As the off-season caretaker at the atmospheric old hotel, he'll have plenty of time to spend reconnecting with his family and working on his writing.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel of manners by Jane Austen.
author: Jane Austen
summary: The story follows the main character Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of the British Regency.

title: Steve Jobs
description: The authorized biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.
author: Walter Isaacson
summary: Based on more than forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years—as well as interviews with more than a hundred family members, friends, adversaries, competitors, and colleagues—Walter Isaacson has written a riveting story of the roller-coaster life and searingly intense personality of a creative entrepreneur.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
description: A book by Jared Diamond that attempts to explain why Eurasian civilizations have survived and conquered others.
author: Jared Diamond
summary: In this groundbreaking work, evolutionary biologist Jared Diamond stunningly dismantles racially based theories of human history by revealing the environmental factors actually responsible for history's broadest patterns.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
description: The classic book on software design patterns.
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
summary: Capturing a wealth of experience about the design of object-oriented software, four top-notch designers present a catalog of simple and succinct solutions to commonly occurring design problems.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
description: Your journey to mastery in software development.
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
summary: The Pragmatic Programmer is one of those rare tech books you'll read, re-read, and read again over the years. Whether you're new to the field or an experienced practitioner, you'll come away with fresh insights each and every time.

title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
description: The definitive guide to JavaScript's best features.
author: Douglas Crockford
summary: Most programming languages contain good and bad parts, but JavaScript has more than its share of the bad, having been developed and released in a hurry before it could be refined.

title: Introduction to Algorithms
description: A comprehensive introduction to algorithms and their analysis.
author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
summary: Some books on algorithms are rigorous but incomplete; others cover masses of material but lack rigor. Introduction to Algorithms uniquely combines rigor and comprehensiveness.

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
description: A guide to improving the design of existing code.
author: Martin Fowler
summary: Refactoring is a controlled technique for improving the design of an existing code base. Its essence is applying a series of small behavior-preserving transformations, each of which 'too small to be worth doing'.

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic high-fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.

description: A dystopian social science fiction novel by George Orwell.
author: George Orwell
summary: Among the seminal texts of the 20th century, Nineteen Eighty-Four is a rare work that grows more haunting as its futuristic purgatory becomes more real.

title: The Name of the Wind
description: The first book in the Kingkiller Chronicle series.
author: Patrick Rothfuss
summary: The riveting first-person narrative of a young man who grows to be the most notorious magician his world has ever seen.

title: Project Hail Mary
description: A science fiction novel about an astronaut who wakes up alone on a spacecraft.
author: Andy Weir
summary: A lone astronaut must save the earth from disaster in this incredible new science-based thriller from the #1 New York Times bestselling author of The Martian.

title: The Midnight Library
description: A novel by Matt Haig about infinite possibilities.
author: Matt Haig
summary: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.

title: Atomic Habits
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones.
author: James Clear
summary: No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving every day. Learn how to make time for new habits, overcome lack of motivation, and get back on track when you fall off course.

title: Elon Musk
description: A biography of the controversial tech entrepreneur.
author: Walter Isaacson
summary: From the author of Steve Jobs and other bestselling biographies, this is the astonishingly intimate story of the most fascinating and controversial innovator of our era—a rule-breaking visionary who helped to lead the world into the era of electric vehicles, private space exploration, and artificial intelligence.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
description: A major bestseller about how our minds work.
author: Daniel Kahneman
summary: Major New York Times bestseller. Winner of the National Academy of Sciences Best Book Award in 2012. Selected by the New York Times Book Review as one of the ten best books of 2011.

title: The Psychology of Money
description: Timeless lessons on wealth, greed, and happiness.
author: Morgan Housel
summary: Doing well with money isn't necessarily about what you know. It's about how you behave. And behavior is hard to teach, even to really smart people.

title: The Wright Brothers
description: The dramatic story-behind-the-story about the courageous brothers who taught the world how to fly.
author: David McCullough
summary: Two-time winner of the Pulitzer Prize David McCullough tells the dramatic story-behind-the-story about the courageous brothers who taught the world how to fly: Wilbur and Orville Wright.

title: The Silent Patient
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then never speaks again.
author: Alex Michaelides
summary: Alicia Berenson's life is seemingly perfect. A famous painter married to an in-demand fashion photographer, she lives in a grand house with big windows overlooking a park in one of London's most desirable areas.

title: It
description: A horror novel by Stephen King about a shape-shifting monster that preys on children.
author: Stephen King
summary: To the children, the town was their whole world. To the adults, knowing better, Derry, Maine was just their home town: familiar, well-ordered for the most part. A good place to live.

title: Gone Girl
description: A psychological thriller about a woman's disappearance and the media circus that follows.
author: Gillian Flynn
summary: On a warm summer morning in North Carthage, Missouri, it is Nick and Amy Dunne's fifth wedding anniversary. Presents are being wrapped and reservations are being made when Nick's clever and beautiful wife disappears.

title: The Exorcist
description: A horror novel about demonic possession.
author: William Peter Blatty
summary: The Exorcist is a 1971 horror novel by American writer William Peter Blatty. The book details the demonic possession of eleven-year-old Regan MacNeil, the daughter of a famous actress, and the two priests who attempt to exorcise the demon.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: A psychological thriller about a journalist and a computer hacker investigating a 40-year-old disappearance.
author: Stieg Larsson
summary: Harriet Vanger, a scion of one of Sweden's wealthiest families disappeared over forty years ago. All these years later, her aged uncle continues to seek the truth. He hires Mikael Blomkvist, a crusading journalist recently trapped by a libel conviction.

title: The Love Hypothesis
description: A contemporary romance novel about a scientist who agrees to fake date a professor.
author: Ali Hazelwood
summary: As a third-year Ph.D. candidate, Olive Smith doesn't believe in lasting romantic relationships--but her best friend does, and that's what got her into this situation.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
description: A historical fiction novel about an aging Hollywood starlet who finally tells her life story.
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
summary: Aging and reclusive Hollywood movie icon Evelyn Hugo is finally ready to tell the truth about her glamorous and scandalous life.

title: Neuromancer
description: A science fiction novel that coined the term 'cyberspace'.
author: William Gibson
summary: The Matrix is a world within the world, a global consensus- hallucination, the representation of every byte of data in cyberspace.

title: Red Rising
description: A science fiction novel set in a color-coded society on Mars.
author: Pierce Brown
summary: Darrow is a Red, a member of the lowest caste in the color-coded society of the future. Like his fellow Reds, he works all day, believing that he and his people are making the surface of Mars livable for future generations.

title: SPQR: A History of Ancient Rome
description: A sweeping history of ancient Rome from one of our foremost classicists.
author: Mary Beard
summary: Ancient Rome was an imposing city even by modern standards, a sprawling imperial metropolis of more than a million inhabitants, a 'mixture of luxury and filth, liberty and exploitation, civic pride and murderous civil war' that served as the seat of an empire that spanned from Spain to Syria.

title: Einstein: His Life and Universe
description: A biography of Albert Einstein that explores his scientific and personal life.
author: Walter Isaacson
summary: By the author of the acclaimed bestsellers Benjamin Franklin and Steve Jobs, this is the definitive biography of Albert Einstein.

title: The Guns of August
description: A Pulitzer Prize-winning history of the first month of World War I.
author: Barbara W. Tuchman
summary: The Guns of August is a volume of history by Barbara W. Tuchman. It is centered on the first month of World War I. After introductory chapters, Tuchman describes in great detail the opening events of the conflict.

title: Leonardo da Vinci
description: A biography of the Renaissance genius.
author: Walter Isaacson
summary: Based on thousands of pages from Leonardo's astonishing notebooks and new discoveries about his life and work, Walter Isaacson weaves a narrative that connects his art to his science.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
description: A history of Nazi Germany from its rise to power to its defeat.
author: William L. Shirer
summary: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich is a book by William L. Shirer chronicling the rise and fall of Nazi Germany from the birth of Adolf Hitler in 1889 to the end of World War II in Europe in 1945.

title: Head First Design Patterns
description: A brain-friendly guide to design patterns.
author: Eric Freeman, Elisabeth Robson
summary: Using the latest research in neurobiology, cognitive science, and learning theory, Head First Design Patterns will load patterns into your brain in a way that sticks.

title: System Design Interview
description: An insider's guide to system design interviews.
author: Alex Xu
summary: This book is a comprehensive guide to system design interviews. It covers the fundamental concepts of system design and provides practical examples.

title: Grokking Algorithms
description: An illustrated guide for programmers and other curious people.
author: Aditya Bhargava
summary: Grokking Algorithms is a fully illustrated, friendly guide that teaches you how to apply common algorithms to the practical problems you face every day as a programmer.

title: Clean Architecture
description: A craftsman's guide to software structure and design.
author: Robert C. Martin
summary: By applying universal rules of software architecture, you can dramatically improve developer productivity throughout the life of any software system.

title: Database Design for Mere Mortals
description: A hands-on guide to relational database design.
author: Michael J. Hernandez
summary: The #1 Easy, Commonsense Guide to Database Design! Michael J. Hernandez's best-selling Database Design for Mere Mortals has earned worldwide respect as the clearest, simplest way to learn relational database design.

title: The Way of Kings
description: The first book in the Stormlight Archive series.
author: Brandon Sanderson
summary: Roshar is a world of stone and storms. Uncanny tempests of incredible power sweep across the rocky terrain so frequently that they have shaped ecology and civilization alike.

title: The Kite Runner
description: A novel about the unlikely friendship between a wealthy boy and the son of his father's servant.
author: Khaled Hosseini
summary: The unforgettable, heartbreaking story of the unlikely friendship between a wealthy boy and the son of his father's servant, The Kite Runner is a beautifully crafted novel set in a country that is in the process of being destroyed.

title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
description: The first book in the Mistborn trilogy.
author: Brandon Sanderson
summary: For a thousand years the ash fell and no flowers bloomed. For a thousand years the Skaa slaved in misery and lived in fear. For a thousand years the Lord Ruler, the 'Sliver of Infinity', reigned with absolute power and ultimate terror, divinely invincible.

title: The Book Thief
description: A novel set in Nazi Germany about a young girl who steals books.
author: Markus Zusak
summary: It is 1939. Nazi Germany. The country is holding its breath. Death has never been busier, and will become busier still.

title: The Lies of Locke Lamora
description: The first book in the Gentleman Bastard series.
author: Scott Lynch
summary: An orphan's life is harsh—and often short—in the mysterious island city of Camorr. But young Locke Lamora dodges death and slavery, becoming a thief under the tutelage of a gifted con artist.
